snippet: The spokesman for President Vladimir V. Putin said adoptions already approved by a court would be honored, despite a ban on American adoptions signed into law last month.
abstract: Kremlin official says that Russian children whose adoptions have already been approved by court will be allowed to join their adoptive families in United States and will not be affected by ban on such adoptions that Pres Vladimir V Putin signed into law in December 2012.
lead_paragraph: The spokesman for President Vladimir V. Putin said adoptions already approved by a court would be honored, despite a ban on American adoptions signed into law last month.

headline.seo: Russia to Allow Some U.S. Adoptions
headline.main: Russia to Let a Few U.S. Adoptions Go On
headline.print_headline: Russia to Let a Few U.S. Adoptions Go On
